In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in split(String(text), r"\s+"))
        if occursin(r"\b\w{${text_width}}}\b", word) || endof(current_line)
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            append!(current_line, " ", word)
        end
    end

    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end

    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```
Here's an example usage of the `wrap_string` function:
```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Aliquam eleifend justo vitae neque tincidunt, ac placerat urna facilisis. Nullam sed fermentum velit."

wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```
This example will split the `text` into lines with a maximum width of 10 characters.
